titleStmt.title: W. W. Fry to James F. Robinson
CWG8730

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Louisville Mar 2 1863
His Excellency
The Governor of Kentucky

Wm Able was recognzd to appear as a witness in the police Court in this city to testify in a criminal prosecution in behalf of the Comth I have a partial knowledge of the fact and from information believe it to be true that he was sick at home on the day he was recognizd to appear was also sick when the sci fa on the recognizance was servd & has continued sick & unable to do business ever since. I have no doubt that his fine ought to be remitted. It is proper however for me to state at the same time that unable to me to act as his attorney in this matter
Pettn to remit fine agst William Able for $100 in City Court of Louisville

$100. } Recog
Remitted
J F Robinson
Issd Mar 18th 1863
